reviews.text: Our family loves visiting Cross orchards.   They have the original buildings from when it was a huge orchard with packing sheds etc. Bunk houses where one of the curators bakes cookies on the original wood stove.  The curators are very informed and make your visit fun and educational.  There are still some apple trees on the property and they hand squeeze fresh cider.  There's even a black smith occasionally making horse shoes etc.

One of the many great options across the Western Slope to immerse yourself in Colorado history.  Much needed when my family and I relocated from Oklahoma.  Lifelong Coloradans should also see what they may be missing out on!
Great place to see old equipment and building. In need if more money to get projects done. But it is a very nice museum.
Friendly atmosphere. Guides are full of information
My friends went for the farmers market while I explored the museum portion. Both were amazing and everyone was extremely friendly. All the items with peaches in them tasted fantastic.

Interesting little museum with a great collection of antique firearms.  Another highlight was the Aztec/Ute Indian connection and the Aztec oral  history that seems to show a connection between the Grand Valley location and the original homeland of the Aztec ancestors.  Well worth the visit.
Love this place!! Its a tad smaller, but I enjoy it more and more each time i go. With the kiddos, without, or even just by myself.
Good amount of information if you feel like doing a lot of reading at each exhibit. Not a great place for kids under 10. Tower has been closed all winter.

Interesting place. Overall fairly low tech but my wife and I still enjoyed learning much about the history of Grand Junction. The collection of guns from across several centuries was impressive. The climb to the tower was worth it. Great 360° views of the city.

We were there as part of the Western Slopes Cowboy Gathering , hosted by the museum.  Another great event and anticipating next year.  The exhibits are always a great view and education on western history.
We look forward to 1st Fridays at the art museum to see the new exhibits, The various art has such depth and imagery  that each piece is so unique, I give this place 5 stars for a  must visit

They are some of the friendliest people I have met here in town. They hold monthly events on the 1st and serve refreshments and au douvres in support of the local artists. It really is a nice gathering and a great way to meet new people and get a look at some great art.

This was a great Arts and Crafts show, we had a very nice time. Local alcohol inks artist Anastasia Kenner was there and she talked with us about classes that she offers. This photo does not showcase her most outstanding works so please check her out. There are so many really good artists that work out of The Arts Center.

I've tried to go to 3 open studio classes, and they've all been canceled with no warning. I've tried to call ahead (no one picks up or returns calls), and look online (it always says classes are a go). So my friends and I show up and nothing happens! Last night a group of people waited for 20 minutes before the site said the class was canceled, and that is awful.
I'm still giving 2 stars because if you can get into a class, it's fun.

The premier and original art venue in the Grand Valley.  Go there.  It is enlightening and user friendly.  Go often. It will enhance the quality of your life.  Something new and engaging every month.  First Friday must do.  Warning!  Parking on First Fridays is free but totally inadequite.... Car pool or use Uber or a taxi.

Interesting little museum with a great collection of antique firearms.  Another highlight was the Aztec/Ute Indian connection and the Aztec oral  history that seems to show a connection between the Grand Valley location and the original homeland of the Aztec ancestors.  Well worth the visit.
Love this place!! Its a tad smaller, but I enjoy it more and more each time i go. With the kiddos, without, or even just by myself.
Good amount of information if you feel like doing a lot of reading at each exhibit. Not a great place for kids under 10. Tower has been closed all winter.

Interesting place. Overall fairly low tech but my wife and I still enjoyed learning much about the history of Grand Junction. The collection of guns from across several centuries was impressive. The climb to the tower was worth it. Great 360° views of the city.

We were there as part of the Western Slopes Cowboy Gathering , hosted by the museum.  Another great event and anticipating next year.  The exhibits are always a great view and education on western history.
Surprisingly good food for a free hotel breakfast.

I went here on a coupon to try it. This isn’t even a buffet. Sure you have the option if cold noodles, with bland sauce from a can. The fried chicken was wet and didn’t even taste like fried chicken. The chicken fried steak that was offered didn’t even look appealing. The salad bar was not fully stocked but at least the leftovers from the day before were cold and on ice. The brownies, if you want to call them that, were hard and tasted like they were made from an industrial can. They made their sandwiches in the microwave. DO NOT GO HERE!!!

If your into no flavored food with not a lot of thought put into preparation this is the place for you. 
Fried chicken, fried chicken strips, chicken fried steak, spaghetti noodles, spaghetti sauce with meat balls, instant mashed potatoes. 

This place could be a gold mine if they just put a little effort into a menu.
Great buffet, very nice staff.
Although the food was not mind blowing the service was amazing. If your looking for a change in your every day schedule and fast food just isn't appealing anymore come here.
This place is AWESOME.  Sam the owner seems to always be there to greet and visit with his guest. We were there for breakfast and what has to be the best Chicken Fried Steak in Northern California.

My favorite breakfast spot. Hands down the best damn chicken fried steak I've ever had. If you don't leave w leftovers I'd be surprised. Quality of food and service is always the best. Thanks to the staff for always being so awesome😁.
Good local Clearlake restaurant. Usually a short wait. Consistently good food and good service. Good breakfast menu. Decor needs an update , overall good experience.
Great food. Good service. Nice atmosphere.  Right next to the lake. Their is a nice big park next door with a play ground.

Sunday breakfast with a 2 year old and a 10 month old learning to eat....the staff was helpful, accommodating and understanding of the mess we would leave behind. Checked in with us often enough to make sure we had what we needed but not enough to make us feel like we needed to hurry up and get gone. Bloody Marys are made right, bacon and all, and the food was balanced. You got a good meal that was worth what you pay. I recommend this place if you're just passing through town. Nice nastalgic little joint. local honey!!

Amazing!!! The samosas are wonderful along with anything else you order. I had an eggplant curry and it came with rice, a yummy side thing, and some sauce. We ordered a bread basket with a variety of naan that was good. The roti is good too. A little crispier than we expected but fabulous. The flavors of all the food is spot on. I didn't take any pictures because I was so excited and ate it so fast! The restaurant is worth the hassle of finding street parking. As far as spiciness goes you can tell them a number between 1 and 10. My husband said 5 and was glad he didn't go higher. He can handle spice normally so the scale is based on Indian taste buds not Americans.

Our downtown go to restaurant for good food and quick service and a nice variety on the lunch buffet. The server was knowledgeable about the different choices. We love spicy and they seemed to have all levels of heat to choose from.

Wife and I went here to have some quick lunch since it was open but when we reached we were told that its about to close at 2.30 PM. We agreed to eat whatever they had at the buffet. Fortunately we were looking for vegetarian dishes so we were not disappointed. The food was really delicious.
The absolute best Indian food ever. Great portions and very sweet staff. Excellent service and added touches for our birthday celebrations. Recommend to anyone that loves curry.

This was my first time eating here.  I was pleasantly surprised how tasty the food was.  We had the lunch buffet.  It was super yummy and not too spicy at all.  I had accidently left my phone there and they held it until my hubby went to pick it up.  Very clean and nice atmosphere...

We just got a to go order for our daughters birthday meal, we picked up 2 dragon sushi rolls. Kinda pricey,  cost about 37 dollars for 2. The taste was pretty good, some of the fish seemed a bit chewy,  dont think they used the highest quality for the price. There was cucumber in the sushi roll, again this was different from what we were used to, but still good.  Took 40 minutes to get the order, but it was a Saturday night... uniforms of the staff, seemed, underclass for a higher priced sushi bar. I think people go to this because it is trendy, not a classy type place. There is also a bar that you can sit at as well. We have visited sushi bars in California and Ohio. So if I was to compare. I would rate food and atmosphere at about a 6.5, but if I was from the younger crowd and not real knowledgeable about great tasting sushi, possibly an 8.

Best sushi in town!!  High quality, tasty sushi rolls. Bento box is also a fantastic option for someone who doesn't care for raw fish. My kids love them!!  Thank you Connor for your wonderful customer service!  Will definitely be back!

Our favorite sushi spot in northern Colorado! This place has great lunch specials, quality fish that's always fresh and delicious, and great service with knowledgeable staff. The presentation if the dishes is always nice and the restaurant is always clean. I highly recommend their signature rolls and sashimi.

It was so busy last night, Friday, we had to sit as a family of four with two teenagers at the Sushi bar.  Chance took care of us, and it was the best experience out of many years of dining at Suehiro.  He was awesome,  helpful, and funny.  What a treat.  Thank you!  We love this place, and now you have given us another reason to rant about Suehiro.

Really good food, but never consistently. We did the chef creation and I could hear the cook complaining about having to create something. Usually it's our favorite because they have fun and create something amazing. Bartender has no clue how to make an old fashioned, hint it does not have maraschino cherries in it. Hopefully next time things go better.

Just want to give a big thank you shout-out to the whole Bin team for making my birthday celebration very special and tasty! All of our needs were accommodated super quickly even though it was Friday night and our party was of 12 ladies. Everyone’s food was delicious. Ladies who have never been at this restaurant before, were very impressed. Our drinks kept coming out quickly! Thank you for stress-free experience so we got to enjoy ourselves!

I don't care how much money you make.   Everyone should come here for the flavor experience. The menu will throw you off. But take the advice from the server.  
 We are construction people. And we don't usually indulge. But as I'm getting older I'm into good food.   It's fantastic.   I suggest going with a group and trying everything on the app menu too.   The drinks are L.A. quality type. The oncologists who put tho together is fantastic
I can review this because I'm a fan of Gordon ramsey and bar rescue.  They teach you what to expect and what you should deserve for your money
5 stars

This is our favorite place to go eat. They have the best hamburger in town. All the menu items are so delicious. The staff is always warm and welcoming. The drinks are amazing, a great variety of beers, wine and cocktails. I love that the responsible source their food and use local farmers. Highly recommend!

What a fantastic place! Sure the food is "expensive" but it is 100% worth it. I personally think the food prices are reasonable considering the quality of food you are receiving. All the food we had was delicious (one appetizer, and 3 entrees), the wine and beer list are extensive, and the staff is very knowledgeable. Austin was our server, and we would go back just to have him as our server again. We will definitely be returning to this restaurant.
Bin burger, Bin Burger, BIN BURGER!!! Wins every time. So good. Awesome fries. Nice ambience, friendly servers. Quality at every step. Keep up the good work, guys!!

Great service and the food is great! We always hang out here every week and holidays. Love Jess, she is our bartender and she is great! Very friendly and fun. Claire is the owner and she's great! Recommend this restaurant any day!!!!!

Busy downtown eatery. Nice bar that is well stocked. The wait staff are busy but always friendly and attentive. The food is also very tasty. The space is a bit smallish but the environment is downtown relaxed and not loud.

We had a reservation for 8pm last night. We sat in what I think was the lounge area with the small tables in the back. Admittedly the tables were slightly uncomfortable BUT! My wife and I had the greatest time! Your waitresses were more than amazing! And the scallops! Oh my lord those delicious scallops! They were single handedly the best scallops I’ve ever personally had in my life (I lived and worked on the water for over 5 years of my life prior to joining the military in 2014) they were so tender and juicy and exploding with flavor. Not to discount the lobster tail (not nearly as great as the scallops but for Colorado lobster tail it was phenomenal!) and the (what I assume was a dry aged) steak was equally delicious. I want to thank you for making our 3rd Valentine’s Day since we  married the best one so far! We will be making reservations again very very soon and celebrating more life events with you at Le Rouge!!!

This restaurant has been one of our favorites in GJ. However, tonight was an utter disappointment. All six of our meals were not good. 
Two of us had scallops and they were lukewarm and undercooked. The rice was barely lukewarm as well as the vegetable. My husband had the steak and it was all gristle on the outside. Two others in our party had tuna and asked it for it rare. There was no sign of pink anywhere in the little strips of tuna on their plate. 
The server was unattentive and didn't seem interested in serving us. She wasn't aware of the menu when asked questions. She said she had just got back from vacation so she didn't know. 
Sadly we will not ever return to this restaurant. 
We'll be going back to The Winery restaurant down the street where they know how to cook their food and the service is amazing.

This restaurant is okay if you keep your expectations low.  Our server was brand-new and she was very sweet. Food I ordered wasn't great, and I returned it for steak frites. They sliced my steak for me, which I think is an issue.
